summary.para: The DISPLAYCONFIG_PIXELFORMAT enumeration specifies pixel format in various bits per pixel (BPP) values.

Indicates that the current display is not an 8, 16, 24, or 32 BPP GDI desktop mode. For example, a call to the function returns DISPLAYCONFIG_PIXELFORMAT_NONGDI if a DirectX application previously set the desktop to A2R10G10B10 format. A call to the function fails if any pixel formats for active paths are set to DISPLAYCONFIG_PIXELFORMAT_NONGDI.
Forces this enumeration to compile to 32 bits in size. Without this value, some compilers would allow this enumeration to compile to a size other than 32 bits. You should not use this value.
